hypothesis_content.title: News-Induced Asymmetric Breakout with Liquidity Grab
hypothesis_content.statement: During neutral regimes, when a major crypto news event (Fed, ETF, regulation) causes a 2%+ spike that breaches the previous day's high/low but then reverses >50% of the spike within 2 hours, price will continue in the reversal direction for a 1:2 risk/reward move.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral markets often see liquidity grabs via news spikes. Rapid reversal suggests weak conviction, creating asymmetric opportunities as stops get taken and price reverts to fair value.
entry_conditions: News catalyst causes >2% spike breaching prior day's high/low
Price reverses >50% of spike within 2 hours on elevated volume
Entry on retest of pre-spike level

exit_conditions.take_profit: 2x the spike magnitude in reversal direction
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Beyond the extreme of the initial spike

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Spike continues beyond 2 hours without >50% retracement, or volume during reversal < spike volume.
